description: Roads near the school will be closed to traffic during busy times following a successful 18-month trial.
title: Plymouth primary school to adopt traffic restrictions after trial
title_page: Plymouth primary school to adopt traffic restrictions after trial - BBC News
maintext:
A Plymouth primary school has said it will make traffic restrictions during busy times permanent after a successful trial.
Stuart Road Primary Academy will become the first in the city to permanently adopt the Safer School Streets, external measures following an 18-month trial.
The rules are designed to encourage families to walk, scooter or cycle to school by closing roads in the morning and afternoon.
Headteacher Britta Nicholls said the move highlighted the school's commitment to "healthy lifestyles" by encouraging daily exercise.
